description:
During our intitial meeting we will define the objectives of this community and see how we can help the business to meet the Data Scientist community of Brussels.

The main question is: 

• How can our community help companies benefit from what Data Scientist can bring.

• How can these companies tap into our experience in order to start new projects.

You are welcome join our DataScience Community :

http://www.linkedin.com/groups?home=&gid=7464520&trk=anet_ug_hm


Twitter: @DataScienceBe

http://www.meetup.com/Brussels-Data-Science-Meetup/

https://www.facebook.com/Datasciencebe
name: Install the group & define first actions and key participants/drivers

description:
Nice lift-off of The Brussels Data Science Community. 

Our first Brussels Data Science meetup ended with lots of smiling faces, many thanks to all the passionated datascientists who actively participated. We managed to articulate our common interests and defined how our meetings could be structured.

We want to:

•  be a knowledge hub for data scientists, we are open to everybody.
• Share knowledge - work on practical business case - learn from others - have fun are some of our driving forces.

Our GOAL: 

"Our ultimate goal is to make the difference by applying our science and knowledge on social challenges."

Next meetup will take place on May 8th.

On the agenda we have 3 presentations :

• Bart will explain how banks use datascience.

• Maxime will show how datascience is  to discover mood trends using Twitter dataset.

• Peadar will explain how nosql can help the datascientist.

Sebastien will lead the discussion around how our community could assist social ngo and charity project. Bart has a potential project sponsor in mind.

 Before and after our event there is a lot of opportunity to network.

We are currently looking for a bigger meetup locations. 

Suggestions are welcome ! 

Don't forget to invite your peers to our event !

description:
HR Analytics Meetup with a focus how new business priorities can benefit from data science. Presentations are again both business as well as technical oriented, for CxO's, HR leaders and of course data scientists.

• Google: Using data for decision making at Google

• Deloitte: High Impact HR by Analytics


• Neo4j: How Graph Databases can contribute to HR Analytics

iNostix will moderate this meetup including a round table after the presentations.

Speakers:

Melissa Harrell (Google), Sheldon Dorasamy (Deloitte - Human Capital) & Sam Rédelé (Deloitte - Analytics Lab Belgium), Rik Van Bruggen (Neo Technology), Luk Smeyers (iNostix)

Doors @6:30 pm.

Unfortunately no foodies/drinks foreseen. Sorry about that.

Data for good project part 4 (Doctors without Borders)

description:
During this hands on session we will focus on Social Network Analysis.

The Format:
Don't expect  presentations, this is a hands-on session. You will be asked to collect and share datasets, work on it with your own tools, together or in group and present your method and outcome on the second day.

The Challenge:
We challenge you to come up with a good way to identify all the potential members for our datascience community.


How to prepare:
No dataset will be provided so Find a usefull dataset beforehand.
Once you found one you can share it on the hackpad.

Commnication:
We will use a hackpad to share .

Agenda:

18:00 The room will be open as of 17:30 so that you can already prepare your dataset.

18:30 In group you define your strategy to achieve the objective

19:30 Short presentations of the strategy of each group

20:30 Working on the datasets

21:30 Wrap up
name: Hands-on : Social Network Analysis Challenge part 1

description:
In collaboration with the IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things Community


Agenda:

18:30 – Update on our Data4Good  activities with Doctors without borders (MSF)

18:45 – Update on our Hands-On session about Social Network Analysis

19:00 – Presentation – The Internet of Things & Data Sciences – Mr Frederik Santens (IoT be group)

19:30 – Presentation – Erik Mannens, Prof. PhD. MEng. MSc.- Prof. on Big Data Semantics @ iMinds-MMLab

20:15 – Presenation – Prof. Ann Nowé, head of the VUB ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE LAB.

21:00 – Round Tabel Q&A & Wrap up Philippe Van Impe

21:30 – Networking in KultuurKaffee – Celebrating our >500 members


 

----------------------------------

It's Official: The Internet Of Things Takes Over #BigData As The Most Hyped Technology http://onforb.es/1ricSSH  #IoT

The Internet of Things (IOT) will soon produce a massive volume and variety of data at unprecedented velocity. If "Big Data" is the product of the IOT, "Data Science" is it's soul.
. Let's define our terms:
. Internet of Things (IOT): equipping all physical and organic things in the world with identifying intelligent devices allowing the near real-time collecting and sharing of data between machines and humans. The IOT era has already begun, albeit in it's first primitive stage.
. Data Science: the analysis of data creation. May involve machine learning, algorithm design, computer science, modeling, statistics, analytics, math, artificial intelligence and business strategy.
. Big Data: the collection, storage, analysis and distribution/access of large data sets. Usually includes data sets with sizes beyond the ability of standard software tools to capture, curate, manage, and process the data within a tolerable elapsed time.
. We are in the pre-industrial age of data technology and science used to process and understand data. Yet the early evidence provides hope that we can manage and extract knowledge and wisdom from this data to improve life, business and public services at many levels.
name: Data Science and the Internet of Things

description:
Part 2:

We had an excellent first session, the objectives have been defined and documented on the hackpad. Members of the team have requested more time to work together on the project. In order to facilitate this we have  decided  to  reserve a full  day.

During this hands on session we will focus on Social Network Analysis. Today the teams will present their outcome and explain what methods and tools they have used.
Best team wins his picture on our wall of fame and a lifetime membership.

The business case & Challenge:
Using you own tools and methods and the available data of Twitter or other social media drivers, we challenge you to come up with a good way to identify all the potential members for our datascience community.
I'm sure some Networked Graph analysis will be very handy.
name: Hands-on : Social Network Analysis Challenge part 2- full day

description:
Dedicated session on Big Data. Our friends from bigdata.be wil explain what issues that terabites of data bring and what architectures are required to be able to manage it. We will have Agoria talking about key projects they support where data analytics plays  a major role, followed by talks from companies involved in BigData projects.

Agenda:

•18:30 Update on resent activities and evolutions by Philippe Van Impe

• 19:00 Wim Van Leuven about Big Data and the influence of data science

• 19:30 Daan Gerits about the technological challenges around BigData and how the ideal IT architecture should look like

• 20:00 Ferdinand Casier about 2 running projects at Agoria (EluciDATA and Made Different) where companies of different sectors are supported in their data innovation and data analytics challenge.. 

• 20:30 Colleague of Sebastien about Big Data Architecture for Telco projects and the value of analytics - project example

• 21:00 A famous CIO about how BigData is making its way within big banks (to be confirmed).

• 21:30 Networking in Kultuurkaffee
name: Big Data & Data Sciences

description: Focus on how science can use data science to improve research.
name: Data Science and Research

description:
The Promise of Big Data

In the early years, data analysts working in telecommunications were hampered by a variety of problems – unwieldy numbers, a lack of computing power, prohibitive costs.

Times are much better now:

Data storage expenses are dropping every day
Computer processing power is increasing exponentially
Analytics software and tools are cheap (and sometimes free)
Business Intelligence (BI) vendors like IBM, Oracle, SAS, Tibco and QlikTech are breaking down the barriers between siloed – separated and often incompatible – data stores to make use of an enormous volume and variety of information.

This is expected to provide a lot of jobs for telecom data scientists. In a 2013 press release, Big Data and Telecom Analytics Market: Business Case, Market Analysis & Forecasts 2014 – 2019, Mind Commerce predicts that the big-data-driven telecom analytics market will grow nearly 50 percent from 2014 to 2019 and forecasts that by the end of 2019, the market will be up to $5.4 billion in annual revenue.
name: Data Sciences in the Telecom Sector

description:
We are organizing a full day event to celebrate our first birthday.
This event will be held in one of the major universities of Belgium.
The focus of the presentations will be on Belgian bigdata and datascience projects.

Government, Universities and Companies will present the value they managed to get out of their analytic projects.In the evening we will have a party in order to thank all presenters and members for their active participation. 

We expect 500 professionals all active in the data science / analytics /IoT /bigdata environment.


We will start the day with a plenary session composed of 3 top presentations.

In the afternoon we will have 5 parallel tracks:

• University Challenge


• Big Data Projects


• Internet of Things Projects


• Data4Good projects


• Marketing and Growth Hacking


There will be plenty of opportunity to network. A Exposition hall will be made available for:

• Companies hiring datascience professionals will be present to explain what kind of projects they are focussing on.

• Universities to explain what kind of courses they are running

• Government organisations to explain how they can assist in Innovative projects.

After the presentations there will be a ceremony to award prices for:

• the most innovative data science project


• the data science project of the year


• the academic project of the year


A party will crown our one year activity. We have invited a rock band to come and entertain us. 

Organisation:

A team has been put together to organise this event, contact pvanimpe@gmail.com if you want to contribute.
name: Summit: Data Science Innovation Summit - Made in Belgium
